alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Upper Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 6:53PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Ada and west central Elmore Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 653 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cinder Cone Butte, or 18 miles northwest of Mountain Home, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cinder Cone Butte around 700 PM MDT. Big Foot Butte around 720 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
